body: Issued opened and patch summited(and applied by ActiveMQ team) using instruction from: http://activemq.apache.org/how-can-i-contribute.html.
Closed as per "[DISCUSS] Combine windows and unix distros" thread on dev list.
can you add a junit test that exercises this feature, that will protect it into the future.
can you rebase your changes from trunk? It will then be trivial to apply for the next release

Done; see https://github.com/apache/activemq/pull/8

Closing this pull request.
Recommend you create a patch that applies cleanly against the activemq trunk git repo:
Patch applied on trunk, many thanks.
![amq-errorhandler](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1269759/2807893/4e3d9926-ccfd-11e3-9947-f0e8d460dc06.png)
This code isn't building maybe an error. I'm going to close this pull request.
Patch for https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/AMQ-5177

Thanks there were 2 other places I fixed that and committed on master. 

Can you close this PR?
Thanks for the PR. Its merged. Can you close this PR
Can you close this PR
We need an unit test, if not we cannot accept this PR.
This has been applied. Can you close this PR.
Sure thing! :)
Closed in favor of PR 22
The solution from 5.9.x is not enough. I'll open a new pull request
Pull request applied in commit 25600944e662279ec1113acd4d27e9c64ba8415f

would it be possible to add a unit test - there are a bunch of karaf feature tests and even seems to be one for the client feature - maybe that can be modified to demo the problem
https://github.com/apache/activemq/blob/trunk/activemq-karaf-itest/src/test/java/org/apache/activemq/karaf/itest/ActiveMQClientBundleTest.java
Solved in commit 6902eaefc46d640ad25c6fa29216bd6efb48c0c4
Hadrian merged this to trunk.  Thanks!
Tim committed this (with some mods discussed on IRC).
Resolved merge conflicts
please provide a junit test case with the patch. that will protect your fix into the future.
Hmmm. My patch to different issues is here. Not sure why?

created new pull request:
https://github.com/apache/activemq/pull/42
It is very same except do not contains unecessary commits as was pulled from dedicated branch.
Unit test needed
org.apache.activemq.store.jdbc.TransactionContext#close already has that logic... maybe see if those two apis can follow the same pattern as the rest and leverage the existing close?
Timothy Bish applied patch. See https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/AMQ-5281?focusedCommentId=14100884&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-14100884
Do you mind opening a jira issue?
Done. https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/AMQ-5505

Hi Marc,

Thanks for the contribution. Wow, quite a bit to digest. I don't know how to test all that, as I don't have access to all the platforms. For starters, would you mind creating a separate issue in jira and help cleaning up the conflicts?
Obsoleted by submitted patch V2

I've cleaned up the PR history, applied with thanks here: https://github.com/apache/activemq/commit/a39e51e0519852332f7779443c3db09b6e691d49

Can close this PR.
I committed a version of this today.
Thanks, I will close the request.
I just updated this request to include a unit test showing the deadlock occurring when the memory store size is larger than the temporary store size.

Found that my code always overrides given socket._, transport._ parameters.
Also wrote 3 more tests for above scenario.
Will push once finished.
In other words improvements are in progress.
like it, nice patch and test. I guess it would be good to track this enhancement/improvement in a jira entry so that it will make its way into the release notes for the next release.
Think you should reference the root pom -  <version>${maven-eclipse-plugin-version}</version>

Created JIRA here: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/AMQ-5729 and updated the Commit message to suit.

Merging.

Will prepare new PR as I have messed up merging back trunk.
This one will be closed soon.

[ActiveMQ-PR-Build #22](https://builds.apache.org/job/ActiveMQ-PR-Build/22/) SUCCESS
This pull request looks good
Kevin, this is a good start but it still uses the memory options when you invoke the status target.  Can we update the script to avoid using the memory options in that case?

Some of your changes appear to be conflicts between your Eclipse autoformatting schema and the conventions in use in the ActiveMQ code (in particular, you appear to be adding spaces around arguments in method calls, which isn't the convention in the rest of the codebase).  Can you please clean that up?  I think this is a good feature that should be merged (and I'll lobby Gary/Tim/whoever to do the merge, since it's sat untouched for a while), but I can't advocate merging something that takes code that is formatted according to the project conventions and makes format-only changes to move away from those conventions (especially since those changes make the commit look more complicated than it really is).
Ah.  No problem. I hadn't even realized I did that.  And I agree that it's bad form to reformat existing code. I'll diff to the original and also verify that my code is compliant.
